required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of the Effect of Food on the Bioavailability of Empagliflozin / Linagliptin Fixed Dose Combination Tablet in an Open, Randomised, Single Dose, Two Way Cross-over Study in Healthy Japanese Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The trial will be performed as an open-label, randomised, single-dose, two-sequence crossover design for the assessment of effect of food on bioavailability of empagliflozin / linagliptin fixed dose combination (FDC) tablet.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum measured concentration of the analyte in plasma (Cmax) for empagliflozin and linagliptin
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 72 hours from drug administration

primary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 to the last quantifiable drug plasma concentration (AUC 0-tz) for empagliflozin and linagliptin
primary_outcome.time_frame: up to 72 hours from drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 extrapolated to infinity (AUC0-infinity) for empagliflozin and linagliptin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 72 hours from drug administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Area under the concentration-time curve of the analyte in plasma over the time interval from 0 to 72 hours (AUC0-72) for linagliptin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 72 hours from drug administration

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- Healthy male subjects age >=20 and <=45 years; body weight: >=50 kg and <=80 kg; body mass index: >=18.0 and <=25.0 kg/m2
- Without any clinically significant findings and complications on the basis of a complete medical history, including the physical examination, vital signs (blood pressure (BP), pulse rate (PR), body temperature)
- Signed and dated written informed consent prior to admission to the trial in accordance with the Good Clinical Practice (GCP) and the local legislation
Exclusion criteria:
- Any finding of the medical examination (including blood pressure, pulse rate and electrocardiogram) deviating from normal and of clinical relevance
- Further exclusion criteria apply
